document.discussion_title: Brazil's gymnastics sweetheart Jade Barbosa falls, leaves in wheelchair | wltx.com
document.topic_text: Brazil's gymnastics sweetheart Jade Barbosa falls, leaves in wheelchair Martin Rogers, USA TODAY Sports , KING 6:30 PM. EST August 11, 2016 Jade Barbosa of Brazil. (Photo: Harry How, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST RIO DE JANEIRO - Brazil’s gymnastics sweetheart Jade Barbosa suffered a heartbreaking exit from the women’s all-around final, leaving the competition in a wheelchair after a painful fall during the floor exercise. Barbosa, who was not expected to challenge for a medal, landed awkwardly on her knees during her first tumbling pass in Thursday’s second rotation. While wincing in pain, she gamely tried to continue. However, on her second pass she made another troubled landing, appearing to damage her left ankle, and immediately stopped, a look of distress on her face. Worried team officials rushed to her aid as she was helped into a wheelchair and pushed backstage, while the sympathetic crowd struck up a rousing chant of “Bra-zil.” Loading... RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 11: Jade Barbosa of Brazil competes on the balance beam during the Women's Individual All Around Final on Day 6 of the 2016 Rio Olympics at Rio Olympic Arena on August 11, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Elsa/Getty Images) Elsa, 2016 Getty Images RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 11: Jade Barbosa of Brazil competes on the floor during the Women's Individual All Around final on Day 6 of the 2016 Rio Olympics at Rio Olympic Arena on August 11, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Harry How/Getty Images) Harry How, 2016 Getty Images RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 11: Jade Barbosa of Brazil waves to fans after withdrawal due to injury while competing on the floor during the Women's Individual All Around final on Day 6 of the 2016 Rio Olympics at Rio Olympic Arena on August 11, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Pascal Le Segretain/Getty Images) Pascal Le Segretain, 2016 Getty Images Jade Barbosa of Brazil waves to fans after withdrawal due to injury while competing on the floor during the Women's Individual All Around final on Day 6 of the 2016 Rio Olympics at Rio Olympic Arena. (Photo by Harry How/Getty Images) Harry How, 2016 Getty Images of
